August 20, 2022
Vigilante
Another mediocre Hulk. Other than Immortal Hulk, WK has not made a Hulk worth the points and worthy of the character yet.
July 1, 2022
odinson51303
Maybe play him with miles and caps shield? Maybe I'm stretching here.....
April 12, 2022
Poison1981
Incredible tie up? You mean he is tied up incredibly easy? Watch as I just tie this stupid Hulk up with a 45 point Panther, woo hoo. Staying power? ...you mean of course, if you can take 3 turns at least to position using sidestep, the other team has nobody who can outwit, has range with pen, or any melee figure with say, a 19 or 20 defense, who can just base this brick as he blows actions trying to roll 9s and 10s. This figures first two clicks virtually ensure this character goes down without a whimper, and exactly why he would never be considered for the points. Like I said, you cut the first two clicks off, make him like 45 or 50, hes almost playable. As is, no "competent player" would touch this piece outside of fringe sealed or trying to create an Avenger swarm using his 70pts for recruiting off of. Nobody would ever use this piece in any remotely serious constructed game. He's not even a good "low cost" Hulk. There are way better ones from much older sets, so lets stop pretending otherwise.
April 10, 2022
SuperClixer
I thought we were getting larger sculpts, starting with the HOX Set. This does not look any larger than any previous made Green Hulk, not counting the AI Hulk. Even if they have gone to approx. 1:43 scale, which is 10% oversized than 1:48 scale, with the Hulk being 8 feet tall, the sculpt should be 2.2" tall, or could be considered having the appearance of 8 feet tall counting squatting position. If they are back to 1:48 scale, he should be 2" tall or appear to be 2" tall counting the squatting. I realize Wizkids has never been consistently accurate with scale, but I think they should be with characters of much larger size in the comics. This not a classic Hulk to me, even for a low cost one. Would of been better with a higher AV and Defense value, and having Leap Climb, for 100 points. We could use one 100 point green hulk with purple pants with the AV TA, to play on a 500 point team with the older Avengers Prime trio figure. We also need a much higher point classic green hulk with Defenders TA. Would of posted that under the GG Hulk #027 Hulk, but would be afraid Wizkids would not see it, and be paying attention to comments made in the Units Section for newer figures.
March 31, 2022
Brundun94
You know, there's something enjoyable in reading comments from people who never play the game. That said, this piece is great to hand new players, and can be potent in the hands of a competent veteran. An incredible tie up, with great staying power, and is a great team player. Play Miles with him to gain super senses and he really becomes one of the more irritating pieces to deal with in the game, sub-75pts. In an age of less damage modification/fewer standalone alpha strikers, he shines.
March 8, 2022
Taliesin
Where's the Leap/Climb?
March 7, 2022
Poison1981
A dial with 2 clicks of 10/17/3, no attack powers and side step is a secondary attacker? What this is, is a melee support piece with a horrible support function. The best you can hope to use this guy for is to run down one of an opponents weaker ranged support pieces and tie them up, thats it. After that hes either getting outwitted or hit with pen and you ARE going to get hit with the fantastic 17 defense. At that point youre just praying for click 5 before hes taken out. Theres no stop clicks, so realistically, hes getting one click in the 3 to 6 range before he is done. The only time this figure will ever be used is on an Avengers themed team in sealed, and thats only if there is no better option. Just a real throw away piece with a great sculpt, and thats a shame.
March 5, 2022
Brundun94
In an age of the game where we've lost a lot of means to increase damage output (perplex, heavy objects, knockback/fall), handing out toughness to a lot of these recent dials that are long, but with no reducers, isn't something to turn the nose at. Definitely adds up. And this Hulk having both traited Invuln and full dial CR makes him a surprisingly nasty tie-up, strong secondary attacker, that welcomes a fight. Give him super senses from Spider-man? Really is getting hard to play even a casual 300 pt game without at least 1 outwit; arguably 2 minimum. Prob is also absolute a must now.
February 13, 2022
Poison1981
Still though, even if you running an Avengers team, toughness? Just use the 008 Spiderman for 60. Thats a superior piece giving super senses, and doesn't have throw away clicks on the top of the dial. I know they were trying to make a "different" and lower cost Hulk, but this Hulk is awful. They should have just made a 40 point, 4 click powerhouse if they were going that way. They could have just bumped click 4 to an 11 or 12 attack, cut the top 3 off, and shipped it for 40. That would be a way more useable piece.
February 12, 2022
KevinLouisOBrien04
You do need to remember that the Toughness only needs to be adjacent if they don't have the Avengers Keyword. If they have the Avengers Keyword, they have it at all times.
February 6, 2022
Poison1981
Brick Hulk? The reality of this piece is that the only slight motivation he gives an opponent to not just let him sit on those first two garbage clicks, is that toughness to other character trait, which requires him to be adjacent anyway. If it were me, I would just let him sit there flailing about while i picked off the rest of his team first. After that, he will go down pretty quick to penetrating from range. Maybe theyll get lucky and get some critical misses to get rid of the throw away clicks... Other than the Avengers team/ key word, I have no idea why you wouldnt use the F4024. Atleast that Hulk isnt knee capped on the front of the dial. Im tired of these 10 attack 17 defense hulks. This one is particuliary bad, since his first two clicks are SO bad. I might play him on the last 5 clicks for like 50 points, but other than that, no thanks. The back 4 of this dial is not measurably better than the affe014 She-Hulk, which is 40pts, and sorry, the top 3 of that dial isnt worth 30. For 30 points you could get the wotr 004 scarlet witch, or some other bang for the buck support piece. Easily one of the worst C/U pieces in the set IMO.

January 18, 2022
Goop
His dial is a bit all over the place. I do like the CR pairing with invul though, it really makes him tough to bring down in close attacks. Starting with sidestep though isn't great for close attacking, will likely need a taxi to get in there. Those middle and late clicks are pretty strong though. He's definitely alright.
